title: Thoughts On Money Management, Fees and Behavioral Pitfalls From An Advisor To Celebrities
author: Seeking Alpha
dc:creator: Seeking Alpha
description: The job of a financial advisor may not differ significantly in terms of the specific tasks they do, but they can be worlds apart based on who they are, and who their clients are. Today I spoke with Tomas Garibaldi, vice president of Bel Air Investment Advisors in Los Angeles. The firm manages a rather astounding $7 billion for just 350 clients, with a minimum investment of $20 million. We talk about how his clients earned their wealth, how his firm justifies his fees, what are some pitfalls of the trade – Learn more about your ad choices. Visit megaphone.fm/adchoices
